Metadata: The Oregon Sea Pen (Volume 2, No. 1, 2, and 3, February, April, and July 1988)
Oregon State University Extension/Sea Grant Program
Three newsletter issues in one entry for 1988. The NSGL did not receive any more issues after 1988.

A bimonthly newsletter of the Oregon Sea Grant Program. The following main topics are in these issues: No. 1: Fur Seals, Sea Otters Unearthed, J. Cone; Volunteers test aquarium waters: Forty Interpreters and 350,000 visitors get to know each other and the sea; Denmark Flume Tried, Touted; Adaptability characterizes vessels, Northwest fishermen, excerpt from B. Rose; Fish-eating fish absolved in deaths of young salmon; Seagulls: Packards with feathers. No. 2: A Fisherman for the 20th Century; Scientist (Jim Carlton) captures aliens, grows them in lab; Ballast water brings exotics to Coos Bay; Solutions sought to marine plastics; Pomfret Cookoff: New fish featured in annual competition; Going against the grain. Survival suits slow swimmers in annual race. No. 3: Good News: Fish Eaters Bleed Better, R. Wander; Report analyzes decades of data, concludes: Different rivers, different salmon; Seatauqua satisfied yen for surf and substance; Who says tourists just want to have fun! Is that a gribble or a timberbeast in the ointment? Fewer fallen trees drift down to the sea.
